Module pipeline
Package tcpassos.pipeline

Interface BranchedPipeline<BEGIN,END>

Type Parameters:
BEGIN - The type of the input element
END - The type of the output element
All Superinterfaces:
BasePipeline<BEGIN,List<END>>
public interface BranchedPipeline<BEGIN,END> extends BasePipeline<BEGIN,List<END>>
Represents a branched pipeline that takes an input of type BEGIN and produces a list of outputs of type END.

    • branch

      default BranchedPipeline<BEGIN,END> branch(Pipeline<BEGIN,END> branch)
      Creates a branched pipeline by combining the current pipeline with another pipeline. The resulting pipeline will execute both pipelines in parallel and return the combined results.
      Parameters:
      branch - The pipeline to be branched and executed in parallel.
      Returns:
      A new branched pipeline that combines the results of the current pipeline and the branch pipeline.

    • connect

      default <NEW_END> BranchedPipeline<BEGIN,NEW_END> connect(BasePipeline<? super END,Optional<NEW_END>> nextPipe)
      Connects the current pipeline to the given nextPipe, creating a branched pipeline. The nextPipe is executed for each element in the output of the current pipeline, and the resulting elements are collected into a new list.
      Type Parameters:
      NEW_END - the type of the elements produced by the next pipeline
      Parameters:
      nextPipe - the next pipeline to connect to
      Returns:
      a new branched pipeline

    • connect

      default <NEW_END> BranchedPipeline<BEGIN,NEW_END> connect(BranchedPipeline<? super END,NEW_END> nextPipe)
      Connects the current pipeline to the specified nextPipe, creating a new branched pipeline. The input of the current pipeline is passed to the execute method of the current pipeline, and the resulting output is passed as input to the execute method of the nextPipe. The outputs of both pipelines are combined into a single list and returned as the result.
      Type Parameters:
      NEW_END - the type of the output of the nextPipe
      Parameters:
      nextPipe - the branched pipeline to connect to
      Returns:
      a new branched pipeline that combines the outputs of the current pipeline and the nextPipe

    • forceConnect

      default <NEW_END> BranchedPipeline<BEGIN,NEW_END> forceConnect(BasePipeline<? super END,Optional<NEW_END>> nextPipe)
      Connects the current pipeline to the specified next pipeline, forcing the connection even if the current pipeline has no results.
      Type Parameters:
      NEW_END - the type of the new end result of the branched pipeline
      Parameters:
      nextPipe - the next pipeline to connect to
      Returns:
      a new branched pipeline that connects the current pipeline to the specified next pipeline

    • forceConnect

      default <NEW_END> BranchedPipeline<BEGIN,NEW_END> forceConnect(BranchedPipeline<? super END,NEW_END> nextPipe)
      Connects the current pipeline to the specified next pipeline, forcing the connection even if the current pipeline has no results.
      Type Parameters:
      NEW_END - the type of the end result of the next pipeline
      Parameters:
      nextPipe - the next pipeline to connect to
      Returns:
      a new branched pipeline that connects the current pipeline to the specified next pipeline

    • join

      default Pipeline<BEGIN,END> join(BinaryOperator<END> joiner)
      Joins the branches of the pipeline using the specified joiner.
      Parameters:
      joiner - the binary operator used to join the branches
      Returns:
      a new pipeline that represents the joined branches
